dict.string: If the Creator created us in order for us to enjoy, then why do we find ourselves experiencing all kinds of problems and suffering?
There is also an anti-Creator that wants us to suffer
The Creator wants us to suffer first, in order to enjoy later
The Creator wants us to enjoy through a giving intention (like His), not through an egoistic intention
The Creator doesn't really want us to enjoy
If the Creator wants us to enjoy through a giving intention, then how do we attain a giving intention?
By doing at least one good deed everyday
By helping out more with charity & volunteer work
By working to increase the importance of the Creator in a supportive environment
By taking less for myself
In the guest & host allegory, what was the host's intention for inviting the guest over for a meal?
To have a good time
To delight the guest
The host had leftover food he thought the guest could finish
To get the money back that the guest owed him
In the guest & host allegory, what was the guest's initial reaction when he saw the "perfect meal" that the host prepared?
The guest wanted to eat the meal
The guest wasn't hungry because he already ate
The guest strangely felt only like eating dessert
The guest wanted to leave
In the guest & host allegory, what made the guest decide initially not to eat the meal, even though he wanted to eat it?
The guest felt that the host also needed to eat together with him
The guest felt that he could gain more by not eating
The guest felt like he needed to lose weight
The guest felt the host's giving intention toward him & thus felt too ashamed to eat
In the guest & host allegory, what is the action called when the guest decided not to eat the food, despite wanting to eat it?
Suppression
Repression
Restriction
Diet
In the guest & host allegory, after the guest decided not to eat the food, what made the guest eventually decide to eat the meal?
The host implored the guest to eat the meal & the guest ate in order to delight the host
The guest gave in to his innate desire to eat the meal
The guest could no longer suppress his desire to eat
The host convinced the guest that the meal was low in calories
In the guest & host allegory, what change took place in the guest between his initial desire to eat the meal & his desire to eat after deciding not to eat it?
Change in desire - from a smaller desire to eat to a bigger desire to eat
Change in action - from simply eating, to playing a negotiation game before eating
Change in intention - from "for the guest's benefit" to "for the host's benefit"
Change in the meal - from eating a hot meal to eating a cooler meal
In the guest & host allegory, what do the guest & host represent?
Creation & Creator
Two friends in this world
A poor man & a rich man
An animal & a human being
According to the guest & host allegory, how can the change of intention in the creation be expressed in 5 steps?
Intention to Receive » Feeling of the Giver » Shame » Restriction » Intention to Give
Intention to Receive » Shame » Restriction » Intention to Give » Feeling of the Giver
Intention to Receive » Restriction » Shame » Feeling of the Giver » Intention to Give
Intention to Receive » Feeling of the Giver » Restriction » Shame » Intention to Give
